bibl.title: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, April 14, 1953

div1.p: Blossom Reed is sending eight books that belonged to her father to Hench. She offers them to Hench for a very modest sum as she would rather he have them than anyone else.

div1.head: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, April 14, 1953
div1.opener:
April 14 - 1953 -
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
Dear Dr - Hench -
div1.p:
Many thanks for your
nice letter about the
books - I found 8 - but
the last one had
no name in it - Only
its belonged to the
sets - you have been
so wonderful about
my beloved father that
I am sending these
books on to you
AC
R
today by Parcel Post-

If you would like
them- you keep
them for a very
modest sum - I'd
rather that you
would have theme
than any one - so
just take your
time about it.

Am in a hurry
to get this off -
